title: Medical Practical Competency Enhancement: Instructional Material Quality Assessment Competency Development: Career Stage-Based Approach

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational science knowledge and experience in developing educational materials
context.additional_context: Practical competency enhancement program for medical/nursing field practitioners

learning_goals: One can explain in detail at least three differences in instructional material evaluation criteria based on educational career stages (novice/intermediate/expert).
One can evaluate the quality of peer-teacher-created materials with over 80% accuracy in VR simulations by applying five core elements (e.g., pedagogical consistency, creativity, practicality).

One can develop customized evaluation metrics considering three dimensions—technology integration feasibility, curriculum compliance rate, and learning stimulation elements—and validate them through project outcomes.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
